author: manunlp
content:
Ran `{LH,Prysm,Teku}x{SuperNode,FullNode}` during 49 epochs.
Then split. Will look at it.

(Teku with debug logs. My docker engine does not respond any more so no dump possible, but I have Prysm logs)

author: parithosh
content: is there something that indicates its anything other than a resource constraint issue? as the issue disappears when we use info logging

author: parithosh
content: anecdotal, but ` 74M    ./cl-3-teku-geth--8c2ec2d0783d4115a16a0921038984ed` for teku and ` 18M    ./cl-1-prysm-geth--abae710bcebe4c8daed38a2baf30d2f6` for prysm

author: manunlp
content:
Yes. Prysm bans Teku peers because they send too many `beacon_blocks_by_range` requests.

`16Uiu2HAm9n4VnS7Pb9ufzMh3U4spuaFwJAYdTsp7i47ewvBvGMfF` is Teku.

I have to check now who is the egg and who is the chicken.

Warning: "too many bad responses" is misleading here. It should be "too many requests".
